conversation.message: Hello Company_C team — I’m Seeker_E and I’m very interested in joining Company_C. Your work and environment align strongly with what I’m looking for, and I’m ready to commit if there’s a fit. I’d like to formally apply and be considered for your open position.

If rejected, I can pivot next round to Company_D or Company_A, where I have relatively stronger priority (Company_A ranks me 1st).

Accepting Seeker_E now would fill our only slot and foreclose chances at higher-priority seekers who could plausibly reach us soon (especially if Company_B takes its top choices or rejects them). Given the early round and realistic possibility of receiving applications from Seeker_C/Seeker_D/Seeker_B, it is strategically better to reject now and keep capacity for higher-priority candidates, even though Seeker_E is enthusiastic and a strong mutual fit.
